thread.title: How the Dow Jones industrial average fared on Friday
thread.title_full: How the Dow Jones industrial average fared on Friday

title: How the Dow Jones industrial average fared on Friday
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Oct 2, 2015, 22:25 BST - UK Markets closed How the Dow Jones industrial average fared on Friday How the Dow Jones industrial average and other major indexes fared on Friday By The Associated Press | Associated Press – 16 minutes ago 75.88 +1.82 
The stock market reversed an early stumble and ended higher on Friday, led by gains in oil and gas companies. Chevron jumped 4 percent, the most in the Dow Jones industrial average. Exxon Mobil also gained 3 percent. 
The Dow Jones industrial average fell 200.36 points, or 1.2 percent, to close at 16,472.37. 
The Standard & Poor's 500 index surged 27.54 points, or 1.4 percent, to 1,951.36. 
The Nasdaq composite rose 80.69 points, or 1.7 percent, to 4,707.78. 
For the week: 
The Dow rose 157.70 points, or 1 percent. 
The S&P 500 index rose 20.02 points, or 1 percent. 
The Nasdaq rose 21.28 points, or 0.5 percent. 
For the year: 
The Dow is down 1,350.70 points, or 7.6 percent. 
The S&P 500 index is down 107.54 points, or 5.2 percent.
